    • Method Detail

      • handleAdd

        private void handleAdd()
        This method loads the CustomerEdit scene for an add after the user clicks the add button. The CustomerEditController knows it's an add because this method does not set the customerToEdit in the CustomerEditController.

      • handleEdit

        private void handleEdit()
        This method loads the CustomerEdit scene for an edit after the user clicks the edit button. The CustomerEditController knows it's an edit because this method passes the Customer to edit to the CustomerEditController.

      • handleDelete

        private void handleDelete()
        This method sends a delete request to the CustomerDAO when the user clicks the delete button.

      • handleCancel

        private void handleCancel()
        This method loads the Main Menu when the user clicks the cancel button.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(URL url,
                       ResourceBundle rb)
        This method initializes the CustomerController and loads the customers to the tableview.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - Unused.
        rb - Unused.

      • bindTableView

        private void bindTableView()
        This method binds Customers to the tableview.

      • bindColumns

        private void bindColumns()
        This method binds each column in the tableview to its appropriate data. This method is a series of lambdas that populate the various columns. Lambdas are easy to use here and make the code easy to read because the setCellValueFactory() methods are factories that take an iterated series of constructor methods as input. The alternative would be a series of for loops, which are much more tedious and less readable.

      • displayCustomers

        private void displayCustomers()
        This method calls the data in the customer DAO to bind to the tableview.

      • getDao

        public CustomerDAOImp getDao()
        Getter method for the customer DAO this controller uses.
        Returns:
        The CustomerDAOImp instance being used.
